quest.name: Diplomacy of the Skillet
journal: Lyngsath wants you to assist Latisha with a matter of great import.
According to Lyngsath, Latisha is in urgent need of assistance. Speak with her to learn what she requires of you.

Latisha needs your help to prepare sample dishes for an afternoon tea being hosted by the Admiral. Do as bade and make a blood currant tart, a serving of pastry fish, and a cup of chamomile tea─all of the finest quality.

After preparing all of the requested items to Latisha's satisfaction, the bookkeeper informs you that she was in fact judging your abilities. Having passed her test with flying colors, you have won the honor of serving as the Admiral's official chef for her coming functions. Keep up your efforts, that you might do the Bismarck name justice.

※The next culinarian quest will be available from Lyngsath upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Deliver a blood currant tart , a serving of pastry fish , and a cup of chamomile tea to Latisha.

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Oi, Forename. Yer jus' the lasslad I was lookin' fer.

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Which is to say, ye be the lasslad what Latisha was lookin' fer. She's in need o' some practiced 'ands, an' ye've got the only ones she'll trust. Well, 'sides mine, o' course, but I've got me own matters to attend to.

dialogue.name: LYNGSATH
dialogue.text: Take fair warnin', though, Forename: the better ye get, the more others'll turn to ye. 'Tis a fine feelin', bein' relied upon, but it can be a right pain in the arse, too. Anyroad, enough o' me prattle─run along an' find out what Latisha wants.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: My thanks for agreeing to help, Forename. Now, I will tell you the details of your task, but I must ask that you keep it in the utmost confidence.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: The Admiral is scheduled to host an afternoon tea for visiting dignitaries, and the Bismarck has been called upon to provide the repast and refreshments.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: I have been charged with conceiving the menu, and require help making a few sample dishes. I would be grateful if you could prepare a blood currant tart, a serving of pastry fish, and a cup of chamomile tea─all of the finest quality.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: As a woman of the sea, the Admiral drinks liquor like most folk drink water, but the same cannot be said of her guests. Hence the afternoon tea as opposed to, say, a dinner banquet.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: Alas, we know little and less of their tastes besides that, so I am forced to consider a wide variety of options. It has proven to be quite a task, but with your help, I am confident that we can serve up a menu to please.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: How are the items I requested coming along? Lest you forget, it's a blood currant tart, a serving of pastry fish, and a cup of chamomile tea that I need─all of the finest quality.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: Ahhh, such a tantalizing medley of aromas! I cannot wait to sample each one!

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: You have outdone yourself yet again, Forename. As soon as our guests seat themselves at table, their noses will be enticed by the rich, relaxing fragrance of chamomile.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: Having taken a warming sip of the tea, their attention will turn next to tart and pastry. For an instant, they are at a loss, as both dishes are prepared with such loving detail. Is this mere food to consume, or art to admire?

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: They feel a twinge of sadness that they must deface such beauty, but that sensation is short-lived. For no sooner do their teeth break the flaky crust than they experience a veritable symphony of tastes and textures.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: The making of pastries and sweets demands not only a delicate hand, but artistic sense besides. And you, Forename, are possessed of both. I can recommend you to the Admiral without reserve.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: I owe you an apology and an explanation─I wasn't being wholly forthright with you. While I am indeed tasked with conceiving the menu for the Admiral's functions, it was also my job to select the guild member who will serve as her chef.

dialogue.name: LATISHA
dialogue.text: And I am thrilled to inform you that that honor shall fall to you, the womanman who passed my test with flying colors! There is no doubt in my mind that you will represent the Bismarck admirably. Keep up the fine work, and be close at hand for when the Admiral has need of you.
